alert.note: Alert for Osborne; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 7:11PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Smith and northern Osborne Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 709 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Alton, or 32 miles southeast of Phillipsburg, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Harlan around 720 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Osborne, Portis and Downs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Lake Waconda, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
